metadata.title: CVE-2017-9831 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability in the ptp_unpack_EOS_CustomFuncEx function of the ptp-pack.c file of libmtp (version 1.1.12 and below) allows attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access) or maybe remote code execution by inserting a mobile device into a personal computer through a USB cable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmtp-common - 1.1.13-1
libmtp-runtime - 1.1.13-1
libmtp9 - 1.1.13-1
mtp-tools - 1.1.13-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmtp package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.13-1').
